name: imnot

body.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wb(wi(w1, w0), wn(w1)))
-| wi(wn(w0), wb(wn(w1), wi(w1, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wb(wi(w1, w0), wn(w1)))
-| wi(wn(w0), wb(wn(w1), wi(w1, w0)))

comment: If a proposition is false, then implying it is equivalent to being false. One of four theorems that can be used to simplify an implication ` ( ph -> ps ) ` , the other ones being ~ ax-1 (true consequent), ~ pm2.21 (false antecedent), ~ pm5.5 (true antecedent). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2019.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 26-May-2019.)
